rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A medical center that specializes in terminating unwanted pregnancies.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Abortion Clinic

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A health professional who practices a therapy that is part of traditional Chinese Medicine and involves penetrating specific points of the skin with long, fine needles that are then manipulated manually to treat painful conditions or produce anesthesia.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Acupuncturist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A facility focused on treatment and therapy for substance abuse.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Addiction Treatment Center

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
Primary entity representing the collection of all anatomical structures. Anatomical structures are the identifiable structures of the body. They include discrete organs like hearts, brains, and livers, and the 'landmark' parts of the body like the elbow, the hyoid bone, and the ascending aorta. They can be either visible to the naked eye (gross anatomical structure) or microscopic.
Things that are anatomical structures:
## Gross anatomical structures (organs).
## Bones (e.g. Fibula).
## Brain structures (e.g. occipital lobe).
## Cranial nerves (e.g. trochlear nerve).
## Ligaments (e.g. falciform ligament).
## Muscles (e.g. biceps brachii).
## Nerves (e.g. vagus nerve).
## Veins (e.g. superior vena cava).
## Arteries (e.g. femoral artery).
## Glands (e.g. adrenal gland, pituitary gland).
## Microscopic anatomical structures, including tissues (e.g. renal fascia, nerve fascicle) and cells (e.g. Schwann cell, Purkinje cell).
Things that are NOT anatomical structures:
## Plant and animal body parts (e.g. paw, gill, leaf).
## Organ systems (e.g. circulatory system, nervous system, integumentary system).
## Hormones (e.g. epinephrine, oxytocin, thyrotropin-releasing hormone). Use mso:medicine.hormone for these.
## Body fluids (e.g. saliva, semen, blood). Use mso:medicine.biofluid for these.
## Cell parts or organelles (e.g. cytoplasm, mitochondrion, ribosome).
## Genes (e.g. BRCA1, CD28 molecule, AE binding protein 1). Use mso:biology.gene for these.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Anatomical Structure

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.anatomical_structure to another connected mso:medicine.anatomical_structure.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Connect To

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all arteries. Arteries are the blood vessels that carry blood away from the heart.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Artery

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A medical structure that provides supportive services to adults who cannot function independently in all areas of activity, but need assistance to assure safety to their well being.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Assisted Living Facility

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A health professional who practices a system of traditional medicine native to the Indian subcontinent.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ayurvedic Practitioner

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A facility that offers various large public bathing areas for communal use.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bath House

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all body fluids. These are the liquids originating from inside the bodies of living organisms. Body water is the dominate component of body fluids.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Biofluid

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all biological samples. These are the biological laboratory specimens collected for research or testing and usually held in biorepositories or biobanks.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Biological Sample

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.biological_sample to its date of collection.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Collection Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.biological_sample to the mso:location.location in which the sample was taken.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Location

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all blood tests. These are the mso:medicine.medical_test in which a sample of the patient's blood is tested.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Blood Test

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all bones. Bones are the rigid organs that provide the structure for some animal's bodies.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bone

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all brain structures. These are the identifiable parts of the brain, like hypothalamus, brain stem, and pituitary gland.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Brain Structure

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing to collection of all cancer centers. These are the facilities focused on cancer research or education or clinical services, or a combination of any of these.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cancer Center

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.cancer_center to its mso:medicine.cancer_center_type.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Type of Cancer Center

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.cancer_center to the boolean value indicating if the center is an NCI-designated comprehensive cancer center.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Comprehensive

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.cancer_center to the hospitals or research institutes that are part of the cancer center.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Constituents

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all cancer center constituents. These are the facilities that are associated with cancer centers and may offer a subset of cancer services or research as a part of the cancer center.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cancer Center Constituent

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.cancer_center_constituent to any mso:medicine.cancer_center(s) with which it is associated.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cancer Center

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all types of cancer centers. Cancer centers may be research only, or offer both research and clinical services, for example.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cancer Center Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A medical center that specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of different types of cancer.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cancer Treatment Center

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all hospitals that cater to children and teenagers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Childrens Hospital

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A health professional who specializes in a manual and manipulative therapy for the treatment of joint dysfunctions, the nervous system and its relationship to the spinal column and its interrelationship with other body systems.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Chiropractor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all compounded drugs. These are the drugs that have been created or altered to fit a patient's specific needs. For example, a pill may be placed in liquid form, or the concentration of a certain ingredient may be altered.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Compound Drug

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a compound drug to one of the drugs of which it is a compound.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Compound of

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all prevention factors for medical condition. For example, 'mosquito nets' prevents the spread of malaria, and 'tooth brushing' is a prevention method for dental caries.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Condition Prevention Factors

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.condition_prevention_factors to the mso:medicine.disease(s) the prevention factor mitigates or prevents.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Prevention Of

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of contraindications. These are the conditions or factors that serves as a reason to withhold a certain medical treatment.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contraindication

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.contraindication to its mso:medicine.medical_treatment, the contraindication is a factor that could argue against the use of a particular treatment.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contraindication For

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A dentist who specializes in improving the appearance of a person's teeth, gums, and/or bite.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cosmetic Dentist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all cranial nerves, which are the nerves that emerge directly from the brain and the brainstem.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cranial Nerve

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A health professional who practices a medical specialty related to the teeth. Includes dentists, endodontists, orthodontists, and oral surgeons.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dental Professional

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A dental professional who holds a DDS, Doctor of Dental Surgery, or DMD, Doctor of Medical Dentistry.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dentist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A medical center that offers diagnostic services to patients, including breast MRI, bone density, breast ultrasound, digital mammography, osteoporosis screening, cardiac testing, colonoscopy, CT scan, diabetes care, dialysis services, MRI, OB ultrasound, diagnostic ultrasound, cancer PET (position emission tomography) diagnosis, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Diagnostic Center

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all diagnostic procedures. These are the medical procedures focused on diagnosis. It includes diagnostic tests like pregnancy tests and diagnostic surgical procedures.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Diagnostic Procedure

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all diagnostic signs. These are the objective indicators of a condition or disease observable by a physician or other clinician when examining a patient. Contrast with mso:medicine.symptom, which only the person experiencing it can directly observe. Examples include elevated blood pressure or a clubbing of the fingers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Diagnostic Sign

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.diagnostic_sign to the mso:medicine.diagnostic_test_signs entity that collects data about the given sign's tests and indicated diseases.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tests

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all diagnostic tests. These are the medical tests performed in trying to diagnose disease or medical conditions.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Diagnostic Test

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.diagnostic_test to the mso:medicine.diagnostic_test_signs entity collecting data on the given diagnostic test's signs and the disease it diagnoses.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Signs

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type collecting the data for a given diagnostic test, the disease it tests for and associated signs.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Diagnostic Test Sign

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.diagnostic_test_signs to the mso:medicine.disease for this test.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Disease

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.diagnostic_test_signs to the mso:medicine.diagnostic_sign(s) looked for or measured in the test for the given disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Sign

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.diagnostic_test_signs to the mso:medicine.diagnostic_test using the given signs to look for indications of the given disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Test

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A medical facility that specializes in kidney dialysis, the purification of the blood by mechanical means in patients whose kidneys are not functioning properly.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dialysis Clinic

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all dietary supplements. These are the substances that are consumed to add to an organism's diet. These substances can include vitamins, minerals, amino acids, and so on. In the U.S., supplements are classified as foods, but can be classified as drugs or other products in other countries.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dietary Supplement

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.dietary_supplement to its mso:medicine.drug_legal_status.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Legal Status

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.dietary_supplement to its maximum intake. This is the maximum recommended dose for the given population.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Maximum Intake

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.dietary_supplement to the recommended dosge schedule for the given population.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Recommended Intake

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type collecting the data for a potential differential diagnosis for the given condition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Differential Diagnosis

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.differential_diagnosis to the mso:medicine.disease that may present similar signs and symptoms to the given condition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Alternative Condition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.differential_diagnosis to the mso:medicine.disease that is is differentiated from the given alternate condition by the given distinguishing factors.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Condition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.differential_diagnosis to the mso:medicine.medical_factor that distinguishes the given condition from its potential alternative conditions.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Distinguishing Factor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Enumeration of the types of disciplinary actions taken against a physician.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Disciplinary Record

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
Any abnormal condition of the human body that causes discomfort or impairs bodily functions. This type includes medical conditions such as injuries, disabilities, disorders, syndromes, etc. that affect the normal functioning of a person, whether physically or mentally.
Things that are diseases or medical conditions:
##Diseases caused by viruses (e.g. common cold, measles).
##Diseases caused by bacteria (e.g. cholera, tuberculosis).
##Zoonosis and vector-borne diseases transmitted from animals to humans (e.g. avian flu, Lyme disease, Bubonic plague, yellow fever).
## Genetic disorders and hereditary diseases (e.g. hemophilia, Down syndrome, sickle-cell disease).
## Chronic diseases and medical condition influenced by other factors such as heredity, environment, age and lifestyle (e.g. breast cancer, obesity, arthritis).
##Learning disabilities, communication and mental disorders (e.g. dyslexia, autism, bipolar disorder) ## Injuries and disabilities (e.g. Burn, Sprain, Snow blindness)
Things that are NOT diseases or medical conditions:
## Stages of diseases (e.g. Stage II breast cancer, Stage IIIC melanoma). In these cases use mso:medicine.disease_stage.
## Bacteria, viruses, toxins, etc. that cause diseases and are not diseases themselves (e.g. Botulinum toxin, Hepatitis C virus, Salmonella). Use mso:medicine.disease_cause for these.
## Symptoms of diseases (e.g. weight loss, swelling, winterbottoms sign). Use mso:medicine.symptom for these.
## Risk factors that are not diseases. For instance, tobacco smoking and exposure to asbestos are risk factors of lung cancer, but they are not diseases.
## Animal diseases that do not affect human beings (e.g. Canine Parvovirus infection, Feline Chlamydiosis).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Disease or Medical Condition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a disease or medical condition to a descriptor indicating the age groups that are affected by the disease, e.g. "affects age groups between 16 and 25, is uncommon after 30 years of age, and is rare after age 40."
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Affected Age Groups

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a disease or medical condition to a descriptor indicating the genders that are affected by the disease, e.g. "can affect both genders. Men are likely to have the symptoms much earlier than women."
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Affected Genders

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Diseases that often go hand in hand with this disease, such as those that can cause or be caused by, or have a high correlation with, this disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Affiliated diseases

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a disease or medical condition to a descriptor indicating the average amount of time required to recover from the disease, with or without conditions.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Average Recovery

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to the free text description(s) of its causes.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cause - Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to an mso:common.text description of its causes.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Casuses Free Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to the free text description(s) of the diseases known complications.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Complication - Free Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to an mso:common.text description of the complications that may arise with the disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Complication Free Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to the free text description(s) of its diagnostic tests and signs.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Diagnostic Test Sign - Free Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to an mso:common.text description of the disease's diagnostic test and expected results.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Diagnostic Tests and Signs Free Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to the mso:medicine.diagnostic_test_signs entity collecting data on the given disease's diagnostic test and the expected results.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tests

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to its mso:medicine.disease_stage(s), the progression of the disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Stages

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to its mso:common.webpage on the Diseases Database website.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: DiseasesDB Webpage

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to its mso:common.webpage on the eMedicine site.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: eMedicine

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a disease or medical attention to a descriptor about what sort of urgent care is required for the disease or condition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Emergency Attention Required

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to the free text description of the expected progression and outcomes of the disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Expectations - Free Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to an mso:common.text description of expected outcomes for the disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Expectted Outcomes Free Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a disease or medical condition to a descriptor about the extent to which the disease or condition is life-threatening.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fatal

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a disease or medical condition to a descriptor about the extent to which the disease or condition can be genetically transferred.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Hereditary

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to its mso:common.webpage on the International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems site.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ICD-10

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to the mso:medicine.icd_9_cm_classification entity collecting data on this disease's classification in the ICD-9 disease classification.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ICD-9

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to its mso:common.webpage on the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology site.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ICD-O

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a disease or medical condition to a qualitative descriptor of the number of people who have the disease, e.g. "common" or "uncommon".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Qualitative Incidence

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a disease or medical condition to a quantitative descriptor of the number of people who have the disease, e.g. "21 million more or less in the United States".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Quantitative Incidence

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Diseases that are part of or a type of this disease. For example, cancer includes breast cancer.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Includes Diseases

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a disease or medical condition to a textual description of how the disease is spread from one person to another.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Manner of Transmission

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that indicates the type of diagnosis required by the disease or medical condition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Diagnosis Required

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.disease to the mso:medicine.medical_specialty that has primary responsibility for the treatment and study of the disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Specialties

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to the mso:medicine.medical_test that will detect or monitor the disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Test

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a disease or medical condition to a textual description of the extent to which medical tests are required to diagnose the condition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Tests Required

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to its mso:medicine.medical_treatment(s), such as drugs and procedures.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Treatments

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to the free text description of its treatments.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Treatment - Free Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to an mso:common.text description of disease's treatment.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Treatment Free Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to its associated mso:medicine.medical_trial(s), those targeting the detection and/or treatment of this disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Trials

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to its mso:common.webpage on the MedlinePlus site.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: MedlinePlus

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to its mso:common.webpage on the Medical Subject Headings site.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: MeSH ID

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to a person with the medical condition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: People with Condition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to its mso:common.webpage on the Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man site.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: OMIM

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to the free text description(s) of its prevention factors.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Prevention Factor - Free Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to an mso:common.text description of the disease's prevention measures.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Prevention Free Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to its mso:medicine.condition_prevention_factors, these are the means of preventing a disease, including vaccines and precautions such as hand washing.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Prevention Factors

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to its mso:medicine.risk_factor(s), including genetic, environmental, and lifestyle risk factors.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Risk Factors

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a disease to a medical specialty that may be involved in a subsidiary manner in the treatment of the disease. For example, nephrology has primary responsibility for treating kidney stones, and urology has secondary responsibility in this case.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Secondary Medical Specialties

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a medical condition to a textual description of self-treatment options, if any, for the condition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Self Treatment Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Source of diseases information.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Source
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: This property is relative to the information source rather than the disease and should be defined there. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to its mso:medicine.survival_rate data for various stages of the disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Survival Rate Data

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to its mso:medicine.symptom(s).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Symptoms

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease to the mso:common.text collecting the data on the text descriptions of the disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Symptom Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a disease or medical condition to a descriptor indicating the extent to which the disease or condition can be treated.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Treatable

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that indicates the types of vaccine available for the disease or medical condition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Vaccine Available

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all causes of disease in humans. These are the pathogens that target primarily human beings.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Disease Cause

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease_cause to the mso:medicine.disease(s) caused. For example, Influenzavirus A causes laryngitis.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Disease

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all disease stages. These are the discernible phases of a disease. For example, chronic kidney disease has five stages with increasingly reduced kidney function as the disease progresses.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Disease Stage

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.disease_stage to its number in the order of the disease's progression.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Stage Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type collecting the data for a dosage schedule. This is the set frequency the substance is taken and in what measured proportion.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dose Schedule

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.dose_schedule to the target demographic the dosage schedule applies to.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Target Population

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.dosage_schedule to the mso:medicine.drug_strength entity collecting data about the dosage's strength: the value and its units.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dosage Strength

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.dose_schedule to the frequency the substance should be taken according to the dosage schedule.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Frequency

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
Any chemical substance that has a physiological effect on an organism. Medicinal, herbal, and illegal drugs are included in this type.
Things that are drugs:
## Substances that affect brain functioning (e.g. Fluoxetine, known as Prozac).
## Substances that affect the body (e.g. Morphine).
## Recreational drugs (e.g. Heroin, Cannabis, Ethanol (alcohol)).
## Legal, non-prescription substances (e.g. caffeine, ginger).
## Hormones introduced to the body from outside (e.g. insulin glargine).
## Toxic or deadly drugs (e.g. arsenic trioxide).
## Brand names (e.g. Advil).
Things that are NOT drugs:
## Fictional drugs (e.g. Red Eye from the anime series Cowboy Bebop).
## Vitamins or nutrients introduced to the body through pills or supplements. Use mso:medicine.dietary_supplement for these.
## Drug classes (e.g. opiate). Use mso:medicine.drug_class in these cases.
## Hormones produced in the body (e.g. insulin). Use mso:medicine.hormone in these cases.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug to its mso:medicine.drug_formulation_ingredient that is the active moiety or moieties of this drug. A moiety is the part of a drug that makes the drug work the way it does, i.e. the molecule or ion, excluding those appended portions of the molecule that cause the drug to be an ester, salt (including a salt with hydrogen or coordination bonds), or other noncovalent derivative (such as a complex, chelate, or clathrate) of the molecule, responsible for the physiological or pharmacological action of the drug substance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Active Moieties

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug to its code in the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) Classification System.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ATC Code

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.drug to the brand names for this drug. These brands should be canonical for this drug -- specifically, there should be at least one well-known formulation sold under the brand that includes only this drug as an active ingredient or moiety, and the majority of other formulations sold under the brand should all have this drug as a common active ingredient or moiety.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Canonical Brands

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a drug to the drug_administration relationship type.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Administration

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug to its mso:medicine.drug_brand, the brands that contain this drug.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Brands

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug to its mso:medicine.drug_class. Drug classes are the groupings of drugs by chemical type, active ingredients, or by medical condition it treats. A drug may belong in more than one drug class.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug class

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug to its mso:medicine.drug_legal_status. The legal status is defined by government bodies that regulate therapeutic goods.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Legal Status

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug to its mso:medicine.drug_pregnancy_category, which is an assessment of the risk of fetal injury due to the drug, when used by the mother during pregnancy.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pregnancy category

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug to its DrugBank ID.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: DrugBank

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a drug to effects that are unintended and a product of interactions with other substances. Note that the property mso:medicine.drug.side_effects should be used for unintended effects that are not the result of interactions with other substances.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Interactions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug to its mso:medicine.drug_formulation(s). This property includes only drug formulations that uniquely include this drug as an active moiety. Drug formulations that are a combination of this drug with others can be found via the active_moiety_of property.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Marketed Formulations

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug to its mso:medicine.drug_mechanism_of_action(s). These are the biological or chemical mechanism by which the drug acts in the body.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mechanism of Action

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug to its mso:medicine.drug_physiologic_effect(s) of the drug in the body.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Physiologic effect

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug to its pronunciation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pronunciation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:chemistry.chemical_compound to its PubChem ID.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: PubChem

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug to its mso:medicine.drug_administration_route, the path by which this drug is brought into contact with the body.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Route of Administration

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug that has a specific administration route to its general drug. For example, the drug 'Aflibercept Intravitreal' is an intravenous form of 'Aflibercept'.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Version Of

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Text describing warnings, contraindications, and side effects associated with the given drug.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Safety Information

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a drug to effects of the drug that are unintended and not a product of interactions with other substances. Note that the property mso:medicine.drug.interactions should be used for unintended effects that are the result of interactions with other substances.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Side Effects

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a drug to conditions regarding use of the drug that must be followed if harmful and even life-threatening effects are to be avoided.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Warnings

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A relationship type that links a drug with one of its routes or administration methods. This relationship type is needed because some metadata and other properties are relative to the combination of a drug and a particular mode of ingestion.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Administration

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_administration to the mso:medicine.drug that is administered by the given route.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_administration to the mso:medicine.drug_administration_route for the given drug.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Administration Route

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all routes of administration for substances. These are the paths by which a drug, fluid, poison, or other substance is taken into the body.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Administration Route

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.drug_administration_route to the mso:medicine.drug(s) administered in this way.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Administered Drugs

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all protected names under which drug formulations are sold, whether patented or not. For example, Advil and Motrin are two brands for the drug Ibuprofen.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Brand

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.drug_brand to the mso:medicine.drug(s) that are used as active ingredients.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Active Ingredients

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The drug (single or combination) that this brand is most well-known for. For brands that are used for multiple different drug formulations, the canonical drug is the common drug ingredient or moiety in the majority of formulations, given that at least one formulation has only the canonical drug as its active ingredient or moiety. For example, the canonical drug for Advil is Ibuprofen.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Canonical drug

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_brand to the boolean value indicating whether or not this is a generic drug.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Generic

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all drug types, like 'muscle relaxant' or 'antihypertensive', these are the groupings of drugs based on similar characteristics like effect on the body or ingredient.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Class

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.drug_class to the mso:medicine.drug(s) that are members of this type.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: drugs

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all flavors used in drugs to make them more palatable.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Dosage Flavor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all forms of drug dosages. This includes instances like 'tablet' and 'liniment'.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Dosage Form

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all shapes in which pills can be formed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Form Shape

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all drug formulations. These are the medicinal products in which different chemical substances, including the active drug, are combined.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Formulation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The active substance or substances in this drug formulation. For many drug formulations, the active ingredients will be the specific forms (salts, esters, other noncovalent derivatives, etc) of the active moieties used in this preparation. Note that some active ingredients may not be drugs proper, but other chemical compounds, botanicals, etc that are considered active by the drug maker or regulator (such as sodium chloride).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Active ingredients

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The active ingredients in this drug formulation, expressed as moieties. A moiety is the part of a drug that makes the drug work the way it does, i.e. the molecule or ion, excluding those appended portions of the molecule that cause the drug to be an ester, salt (including a salt with hydrogen or coordination bonds), or other noncovalent derivative (such as a complex, chelate, or clathrate) of the molecule, responsible for the physiological or pharmacological action of the drug substance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Active ingredient moieties

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: DEPRECATED - use /medicine/drug_formulation/active_ingredient_moieties.\n\nThe active ingredients in this drug formulation, expressed as moieties. A moiety is the part of a drug that makes the drug work the way it does, i.e. the molecule or ion, excluding those appended portions of the molecule that cause the drug to be an ester, salt (including a salt with hydrogen or coordination bonds), or other noncovalent derivative (such as a complex, chelate, or clathrate) of the molecule, responsible for the physiological or pharmacological action of the drug substance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Active moieties

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Brand names in which this formulation is available.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Brand names

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_formulation to its mso:medicine.drug_dosage_form(s), in which this drug is made available. Examples include tablet, injection, capsule, and so forth.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dosage form

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_formulation to its mso:medicine.drug_formulation_category.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Category

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The legal status of this drug formulation, as defined by government bodies that regulate therapeutic goods.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Legal status

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_formulation to its mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form(s), which are the equivalent forms in which this formulation is manufactured or made available. All manufactured forms must be pharmaceutically equivalent (same active compounds, strengths, dosage form, routes), but need not be therapeutically equivalent.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Manufactured Forms

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The pregnancy category of a drug formulation is an assessment of the risk of fetal injury due to the drug formulation, when used by the mother during pregnancy.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pregnancy category

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_formulation to its mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form that is its reference form. For example, in the US, certain drugs are designated by the FDA as reference drugs, and are used as standards for defining therapeutic equivalence.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Reference form

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The route(s) of administration, or path(s) by which this drug is brought into contact with the body.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Routes of administration

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_formulation to its mso:medicine.drug_strength of the constituent chemical compounds in this drug formulation. For drug formulations that have multiple active chemical compounds, multiple strengths should be specified, one for each active chemical compound.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Strength

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all drug formulation categories. These are the groupings of drug formulations by common characteristics.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Formulation Category

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all drug ingredients. These are the active and inert ingredients that are used in pharmaceutical products.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Ingredient

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.drug_formulation_ingredient to the mso:medicine.drug(s) in which the ingredient is an active ingredient.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Active Moiety of Drug

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: More general forms of this ingredient.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: More general ingredient

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type collecting the data on the label section of a drug, including the text, and online version, and the code.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Label Section

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_label_section to the boolean value indicating the section is a prominent warning, such as an FDA "boxed warning".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Prominent Warning

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_label_section to its Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes code, which describes the contents of the section.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Section LOINC code

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Name of the label section, such as Indications, Contraindications, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Section name

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Human-readable highlight text for the label section, if available.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Highlight text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Direct link to the section in an online version of the drug label
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Section URI

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all drug legal statuses.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Legal Status

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_legal_status to the mso:location.sovereign with this drug legal status classification.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Country

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all drug manufacturers. These are the mso:business.operations that manufacture mso:medicine.drugs.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Manufacturer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the mechanism of action for chemical substances. Mechanism of action is the concept of biochemical interactions by which a drug substance produces its pharmacological effect. It usually includes the specific molecular targets to which the drug bind, if applicable.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Mechanism of Action

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all physiologic effects that drugs can have on the body.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Physiologic Effect

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all pregnancy categories used to denote the risk to a fetus if the drug is taken by a pregnant woman.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Pregnancy Category

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_pregnancy_category to the mso:location.sovereign(s) that use this category.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Country

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.drug_pregnancy_category to the mso:medicine.drug_formulation(s) with this categorization.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Formulation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.drug_pregnancy_category to the mso:medicine.drug(s) with this categorization.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drugs in Category

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_pregnancy_category to the the expected risk of fetal injury when drugs in this category are used by the mother during pregnancy. Typically defined by the regulating agency that establishes this pregnancy category.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pregnancy Risk Statement

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_pregnancy_category to the mso:medicine.drug_regulating_authority that established this category.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Regulating Authority

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all drug regulating authorities. These are the organizations that have been given the authority to regulate drugs.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Regulating Authority

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.drug_regulating_authority to mso:medicine.drug_pregnancy_category(s) that are recognized by this authority.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pregnancy Categories

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type collecting the data for the strength of a given ingredient within a drug formulation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Strength

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_strength entity to the mso:medicine.drug_formulation_ingredient used at the given strength in a particular formulation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Active Ingredient

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_strength entity to the text units for the strength value, for example, mg/L.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Strength Units

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.drug_strength to the value of the strength of the active ingredient.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Strength Value

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type collecting the data for a given mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form's equivalence to other forms of the same or different drugs.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drug Therapeutic Equivalence
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is not needed. A drug can point directly at its therapeutic equivalent. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine:drug_therapeutic_equivalence_relationship to the mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form(s) that have been determined to be therapeutically equivalent.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Equivalent
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type of this property has been deprecated. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A medical facility that specializes in treating disorders like obesity, anorexia nervosa, and bulimia nervosa.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Eating Disorder Treatment Center

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Critical medical care that is offered outside of a hospital. Includes various emergency response services and ambulance Services (which transport patients with illnesses and injuries to definitive care).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Emergency Medical Service

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A dentist who specializes in conditions related to the root canal.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Endontist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all epidemics. These are the widespread outbreaks of infectious disease, where many people are infected at the same time.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Epidemic

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.epidemic to the mso:medicine.infectious_disease that is the cause of the epidemic.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Disease

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.epidemic to the number of people infected, both those who survived and fatalities.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Infected

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of exercise plans. These are the programs or specific guidelines to achieve a fitness goal.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Exercise Plan

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.exercise_plan to the total number of calories burned with a session of the exercise plan.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Calories Burned

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for sections of FDA monographs that are published standards regulating drugs.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: FDA OTC Drug Monograph Part

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A medical center that provides DNA-related testing services, tests for genetic diseases or prenatal diagnosis.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genetic Testing Facility

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who specializes in improving the health of patients. Includes physicians, surgeons, nurses, and practitioners of natural medicine.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Health Professional

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a health professional to a health insurance plan accepted by the professional.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Insurance Accepted

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a health professional to a major specialization of the practitioner, e.g. neurology.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Specialty

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a physician to a minor specialization of the practitioner, e.g. dermatology.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subspecialty

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A health professional who specializes in an approach to medical care that emphasizes the study of all aspects of a person's health, including physical, psychological, social, economic, and cultural factors.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Holistic Healer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A health professional who practices a form of alternative medicine whose guiding assumption is that a substance that causes the symptoms of a disease in healthy people will cure similar symptoms in sick people.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Homeopath

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all hormones. Hormones are the secretions of the endocrine glands that are transmitted by blood to the tissues. Hormones are used by a body to regulate physiological and behavioral activities.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Hormone

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all hospitals. Hospitals are the mso:location.medical_structures that provide patients with medical treatment, either on an out-patient or in-patient basis.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Hospital

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.hospital to the mso:measurement_unit.dated_integer collecting the data on the number of hospital beds at the hospital and the value's validity date.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Beds

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Ownership/funding for the hospital. Examples are: state, for-profit, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ownership Status

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.hospital to the mso:education.university with which the hospital is affiliated.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical School Affiliation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.hospital to its mso:medicine.medical_specialty(s).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Specialties

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a hospital to a standard descriptor indicating the type of ownership of the hospital, e.g. private, military, and public.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ownership Status

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type collecting the data for a physician's affiliation with a hospital.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Hospital Affiliation
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is not necessary. A physician can be directly related to an affiliated hospital. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:medicine.physician.hospital_affiliation]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.hospital_affiliation_relationship to the hospital, an instance of mso:local.entity.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Hospital
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type of this property has been deprecated. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.hospital_affiliation_relationship to the mso:medicine.physician associated with the given hospital.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Physician
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type of this property has been deprecated. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The type of ownership this hospital has; e.g. non-profit, state, military, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ownership Status
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type of this property is deprecated, and the expected type contains kinds of hospitals rather than statuses of hospitals. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all types of hospitals by ownership types, including private, military, and public.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Hospital Ownership Status

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.hospital_ownership_status to the mso:medicine.hospital_ownership(s) with this ownership type.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Hospitals

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A health professional who specializes in hypnosis as a form of therapy for humans.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Hypnotherapist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type collecting the data on the ICD-9 disease classification standard.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ICD-9-CM Classification

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.icd_9_cm_classification entity to its code in the ICD-9 disease classification system.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Code

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Child nodes of this node in the ICD-9-CM hierarchy
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Includes classifications

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all imaging tests. These are the mso:medicine.medical_test that utilize some form of mso:medicine.medical_imaging_technique for diagnostic or measurement purposes.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Imaging Test

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.imaging_test to its mso:medicine.medical_imaging_technique.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Imaging Technique

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of infectious diseases. These are the diseases that occur when an infectious agent invades a host's bodily tissues. The disease is usually a reaction to the agent's bodily invasion and subsequent multiplication and waste production.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Infectious Disease

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.infectious_disease to its mso:medicine.type_of_infectious_agent that transmits the disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Infectious Agent Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.infectious_disease to its mso:medicine.transmission_route, the ways in which this disease spreads.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Transmission Route

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:infectious_disease to its mso:medicine.vaccine, the injections intended to create antibodies to the disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Vaccine

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.infectious_disease to its mso:medicine.vector_of_disease, which are organisms that do not cause disease but rather transmit the infection.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Vector

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all influenza samples. These are the biological samples of influenza taken for study or testing.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Influenza Sample

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.influenza_sample to the mso:medicine.influenza_subtype that describes the H subtype of this kind of influenza.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: H Subtype

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.influenza_sample to the mso:medicine.influenza_subtype that describes the N subtype of this kind of influenza.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: N Subtype

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all influenza subtypes. These are the designations of influenza viruses that correspond to the antibody responses to HA and NA, for example H5N1 is a subgrouping of influenza based on these subtypes.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Influenza Subtype

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all injury events. These are the events in which a person sustains physical damage to the body. Causes include violence, accidents, and so forth. Not included in this collection is disease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Injury

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.injury_event to the mso:medicine.disease resulting from the injury as a complication.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Complications

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.injury to the mso:medicine.injury_type that the injury is claassified as.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Injury Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.injury_event to the mso:medicine.medical_treatment used to treat the injury sustained.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Treatment

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all injury types. These are the groupings of injuries like, 'chest injury', 'cervical fracture', and 'bone fracture'.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Injury Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.injury_type to its broader grouping mso:medicine.injury_type.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Supertype

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of body joints, which are the points of connection between the two bones or elements of a skeleton.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Joint

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing lifestyle modification, which are the medical treatments that modify aspects of the patient's lifestyle and include exercise and diet styles and plans.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lifestyle Modification

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all ligaments. These are the fibrous tissue that connects bones to other bones
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ligament

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all lymphatic vessels. These are the vessels that carry lymph in the body.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lymphatic Vessel

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.lymphatic_vessel to the mso:biology.organism_part the vessel drains lymph from.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Region Drained

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all manufactured drug forms. These are the drug formulations that are or have been manufactured.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Manufactured Drug Form

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The country or countries in which this specific labeled drug form is available.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Available in

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to the boolean value indicating whether or not the form has a coating. Examples include sugar coating, film coating, or enteric coating. Only coatings to the external surface or the dosage form should be considered, exclude coatings to individual pellets or granules inside a capsule or tablet.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Coating

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: For solid oral dosage forms (tablets, etc), color of product.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Color

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to the boolean value indicating whether or not the drug is still commercially available.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Discontinued

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to its FDA application number. Drugs may have multiple application numbers if they have been reformulated at some point in their history.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: FDA Application Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to an mso:medicine.fda_otc_monograph_part, which is the section of the FDA monograph, the FDA's published standards, that regulates a given drug.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: FDA OTC Monograph Part

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to its mso:medicine.drug_dosage_flavor, cherry, strawberry, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Flavor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to a boolean value indicating whether or not the drug is a generic.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Generic Drug

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to the string representation of its imprint.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Imprint

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to the last revision date of its label.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Label Revision Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to a link to its drug label on the corresponding regulatory authority's web site, e.g. US NLM DailyMed site.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Label link

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to its mso:medicine.drug_label_section(s) of information contained in the drug label, such as Indications, Contraindications, Box warning, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Label sections

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The manufacturer of this version of a drug formulation. As there may be many organizations that cooperate to bring a drug to market, this property should be set to the organization that ultimately markets the drug to users, typically also the one that is listed on the drug's label.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Manufacturer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Date on which this drug form was discontinued (if applicable).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Marketing end date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Date on which this drug form was first marketed / made available.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Marketing start date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.menufactured_drug_form to its National Drug Code (NDC) product code(s).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: NDC Product ID

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to mso:law.patent(s) that apply to the drug form..
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Patents

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to the date of expiration for its last patent.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Patent Expiry Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to its scoring. For solid oral dosage forms, the value is the number of equal-sized pieces the product can be broken into using score marks. A "1" represents a non-scored product, "2" can be broken into two equal pieces, "3" can be broken into 3 equal pieces, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Scoring

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to its mso:medicine.drug_form_shape(s). Note mso:medicine.drug_form_shape is deprecated, and the expected type will change to mso:common.shape in the future.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Shape

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to its size in mm.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Size

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to a boolean value that indicates whether or not the product has a mark or symbol appearing on it for easy and definite recognition. Score lines, letters, numbers, and internal and external cut-outs are not considered marks or symbols.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Symbol Mark

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.manufactured_drug_form to its mso:medicine.drug_therapeutic_equivalence_relationship, which collects data on other manufactured drug forms that are therapeutically equivalent, or bioequivalent. Therapeutic equivalence is defined as being pharmaceutically equivalent and demonstrated through in vitro or in vivo studies to have the same clinical effect and safety profile. Note that the expected type of this property should eventually be changed to medicine.manufactured_drug_form.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Therapeutic Equivalents

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Stores that specialize in selling marijuana, often for medical purposes, and products for consuming marijuana, e.g. water pipes.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Marijuana Store

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A clinic that specializes in manipulating the superficial and deeper layers of muscle and connective tissue using various techniques to enhance function, aid in the healing process, decrease muscle reflex activity, inhibit motor-neuron excitability, and promote relaxation and well-being.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Massage Clinic

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all medical clinics. Clinics are the health care facilities that are primarily devoted to outpatient care.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Clinic

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_clinic to the available services at the clinic.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Available Service

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_clinic to the mso:medicine.medical_specialty associated with the clinic.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Specialty

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all medical devices. These are the devices that that is used to diagnose, prevent, or treat disease or other conditions. Devices do not achieve its purposes through chemical action within or on the body, which are mso:medicine.drug. Medical devices act by other means like physical, mechanical, or thermal.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical device

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all levels of medical evidence. This type can include entities like 'clinical trial' or 'physician consensus'. Also included in this type are more formalized notions of evidence levels such as those advocated by Evidence-based practice (EBP) researchers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Evidence Level

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all medical factors. These are the various risk factors, signs, symptoms and other variables that are used to diagnose and make treatment recommendations.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Factor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all medical guidelines. These are the pieces of text that are either recommendations made by a medical standards body or are a consensus statement regarding health.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Guideline

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_guideline to the level of evidence for the guideline.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Evidence Level

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all techniques of creating visual representation of the body for medical purposes.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Imaging Technique

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all medical indications. These are the valid reasons to use a given medical procedure, test, or treatment. These reasons include known conditions, signs or symptoms, risk factors, and so forth. Its opposite concept is mso:medicine.contraindication.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Indication

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for medical licenses, including information about the issuing state.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical License

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_license to the text name of the state where medical license is issued.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: License State

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all organizations that have a medical mission, including organizations that fund and/or perform medical research and clinical practice.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Organization

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all courses of action for an individual intended to result in care of some aspect of health: physical, mental, and dental health. Included in this type are the activities that generally improve the individual's health, treat a disease or injury, or make a diagnosis.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Procedure

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_procedure to the biology.organism_part that is associted with this procedure. For example, blood tests are associated with the blood, lobotomy is associated with the brain, and the EKG is associated with the heart.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Associated Anatomy

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_procedure to the mso:medicine.drug that affects the results of the procedure.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Affected By

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_procedure to the mso:medicine.medical_device that is used in the test.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Device

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_procedure to the description of the changes in the normal mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions that are associated with this procedure.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pathophysiology

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all tools, scales, and other rule sets that estimate the risk of complications or developing conditions.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Risk Estimator

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_risk_estimator to the biology.physiological_condition the estimator estimates the risk of.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Estimates Risk of

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_risk_estimator to the mso:medicine.risk_factor used in the estimator.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Includes Risk Factor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all medical specialties. These are the branches of medicine in which physicians usually extend their studies.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Specialty

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating a medical specialty to a disease for which the medical specialty has primary responsibility.
