rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Associated Diseases or Conditions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a medical specialty to a test that is given by the specialty to diagnose a disease for which the specialty has primary responsibility.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tests Administered

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all medical studies. Medical studies are the research studies that focus on human medicine or health.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Study

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Retail outlets that offer equipment, apparatus, and instruments that are used in diagnostic, surgical, and therapeutic procedures, e.g. hygiene disposables, medical scales, and prosthetics.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Supply Store

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all medical tests. These are the medical procedures, or sets of procedures, that are intended to detect, diagnose, or monitor a disease process.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Test

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_test to the mso:medicine.disease the test tests for.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Test Diagnoses

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.diagnostic_test to the description of the normal values for a typical patient.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Normal Values

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all medical test panels. These are the sets of mso:medicine.medical_test frequently ordered together to diagnose a disease or condition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Test Panel

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_test_panel to the mso:medicine.medical_test that is included in the panel.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Includes Test

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A type containing standard descriptors for any medical intervention designed to treat and cure human diseases and medical conditions. This type includes both curative and palliative treatments.
Things that are medical treatments:
## Drugs and other pharmacological treatments (e.g. Aspirin, Clotrimazole, steroidal ophthalmic drops), including illegal and recreational drugs that are also used for medical treatment (e.g. Amyl Nitrite, Cannabis, Dextromethamphetamine).
## Vitamins, minerals, enzymes, antibodies, hormones, etc. used as ingredients or active compounds in pharmacological and medical treatments.
## Herbs and herbal treatments (e.g. Ephedra, St. John???s Wort, bitter melon).
## Psychotherapies, as well as behavioral and other corrective therapies (e.g. exposure therapy, cognitive behavioral therapy, Speech therapy).
## Surgeries, transplants and related procedures (e.g. coronary artery bypass surgery, kidney transplantation).
## Medical procedures that are intended to treat diseases (e.g. radiation therapy).
## Exercise, fitness routines, and diet (e.g. physical exercise, low sodium diet).
## Palliative treatments that do not cure diseases but alleviate pain and discomfort. (e.g. morphine, bronchodilators, Dolasetron, hormone replacement therapy).
Things that are NOT medical treatments:
## Purely preventative medical procedures and devices that do not cure any medical conditions, including vaccines (e.g. flu vaccine, Polio vaccine), medical devices (e.g. dental floss, condoms), and diagnostic tests and similar procedures (e.g. chest X-ray, blood test, electrocardiogram).
## Machines and devices used in treatments and medical procedures (e.g. portable ultrasound, X-ray machine, Tympanostomy tube). Use mso:medicine.medical_device in these cases.
## Medical trials (e.g. Nimtuzumab in adults with glioblastoma multiforma, Hypertension prevention trial feasibility study). Use mso:medicine.medical_trial for these.
## Paranormal, religious, and faith healing procedures (e.g. psychic surgery, therapeutic touch, laying on of hands).
## Veterinary medical treatments and procedures (e.g. Sulfadimethoxine, fecal parvovirus test).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Treatment

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_treatment to the condition or factors that make a given treatment inadvisable for a patient.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contraindications

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_treatment to the mso:medicine.medical_trial(s) testing its efficacy and safety.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Trials

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_treatment to the mso:medicine.symptom(s) that are side effects, the unintended by-products of a medical treatment.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Side Effects

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.medical_treatment to the mso:medicine.disease(s) it is used to treat.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Used to Treat

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all medical trials. These are the research studies that are designed to answer specific questions about biomedical or behavioral interventions.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Trial

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to its text identifier at ClinicalTrials.gov.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to the msp:people.person listed as the trial's contact person.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contact

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to the mso:medicine.medical_trial_design(s) used in the trial.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Design

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to mso:medicine.disease(s) the trial is researching.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Diseases

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to the mso:people.gender(s) eligible for this trial.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Eligibile Genders

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to the text description of the exclusion criteria for participants in this trial.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Eligibility Exclusion Criteria

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to the inclusion criteria for participants in this trial.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Eligibility Inclusion Criteria

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to the total number of expected participants to enroll.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Expected Total Enrollment

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to the mso:medicine.medical_trial_health_authority under which the trial was conducted.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Health Authority

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to the date of the trial's last follow-up on participants.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Last Follow-up

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to the maximum eligible age of participants.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Maximum Age for Eligibility

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to its mso:medicine.medical_trial_type.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Type of Trial

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to the minimum eligible age for participants.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Minimum Age for Eligibility

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to its mso:medicine.medical_trial_phase, indicating how far along in testing the treatment is.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Phase

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to the primary outcomes of the trial. The primary outcome is the most important outcome from the trial.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Primary Outcomes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to the mso:book.cited_work that references the trial.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: References

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to its secondary outcomes. Secondary outcomes are used to evaluate additional effects of the intervention.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Secondary Outcomes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to the mso:medicine.medical_trial_sponsor(s) of the trial. These are the agents that funded or performed or in some other way supported the trial.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Sponsor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:medicine.medical_trial to the mso:medicine.medical_treatment(s) being tested in this trial.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Treatment Tested

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all medical trial designs. These are the general attributes of medical trials. Instances include 'dose comparison' and 'double-blind'.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Trial Design

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all medical trial health authorities. These are the organizations given the authority to oversee medical trials, usually by a government.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Trial Health Authority

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all medical trial phases. These are the clinical trials a drug must pass through to be considered safe effective and receive approval for sale from health authorities.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical Trial Phase

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all medical trial sponsors. These are the agents that fund, perform, or in some other way, sponsor medical trials.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Health professionals that specialize in optometry, with focus on the examination, diagnosis, treatment, and management of eye health. Unlike ophthalmologists, optometrists typically do not have an MD and are not trained or licensed to provide the full spectrum of eye care.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A surgeon who specializes in procedures like the removal of teeth, bone grafting, and preprosthetic surgery to provide better anatomy for the placement of implants or dentures.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A dental professional who specializes in the diagnosis of improper bites and their treatment with dental braces.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all medical procedures that are palliative in nature. This care focuses on providing relief from the symptoms, pain, physical stress, and mental stress of a serious illness, regardless of the patient's diagnosis. The idea here is to improve the patient's quality of life.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Palliative Procedure

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all pathology tests. These are the mso:medicine.medical_test in which tissue, cell, and fluid samples are examined to study diseases.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A symptom is a sign or indication of the existence of a disease or medical condition. A symptom can be either a sensation, a change in health function or a physical condition which indicates a particular illness or disorder in humans.
Things that are symptoms:
## Purely subjective sensations noticed only by the patient (e.g. anxiety, dizziness, back pain).
## Objective signs detected upon physical examination or medical testing (e.g. breast lump, Hematuria, Blumberg sign, Duroziez???s sign).
## Diseases and medical conditions that are also symptoms of other diseases (e.g. diarrhea, Arthritis, Anorexia, Dysmenorrhea). In these cases the type mso:medicine.disease should also be used.
## Risk factors of diseases that are also symptoms (e.g. Hypotension is a symptom of dehydration; at the same time, it is also a risk factor for acute renal failure). In these cases the type mso:medicine.risk_factor should also be used.
Things that are NOT symptoms:
## Diseases and medical conditions that are not symptoms of diseases (e.g. lung cancer, Chickenpox, Poliomyelitis). Use mso:medicine.disease for these.
## Anything that causes diseases or medical conditions (e.g. Poliovirus, exposure to allergens, pollution). Use mso:medicine.disease_cause for these.
## Anything that increases a person's likelihood of developing or contracting a disease or medical condition (e.g. radiation therapy, tobacco smoking, sedentary lifestyle). Use mso:medicine.risk_factor in these cases.
## Stages of diseases (e.g. stage 0 bladder cancer, stage I bladder cancer). Use mso:medicine.disease_stage for these cases.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Symptom

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a symptom to a textual description of other symptoms that, when they occur together, may require *eventual* diagnosis and treatment by a medical professional.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Associated Symptoms Requiring Eventual Medical Intervention

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a symptom to a textual description of other symptoms that, when they occur together, may require *immediate* diagnosis and treatment by a medical professional.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Associated Symptoms Requiring Immediate Medical Intervention

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a symptom to a textual description of common causes of the symptom. Note that common causes are not diseases or medical conditions ??? they are descriptions of behavior, food choices, events, etc. that often lead to the expression of the symptom.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Common Causes

These are ways in which the infectious agents of a disease are transmitted from individual to individual. It includes entities like 'oral transmission' and 'droplet contact transmission'.

vaccine
